fields.content:
Tendenci is a complex yet easy-to-use software package that powers web sites around the world! You can use as much or as little of the software as you need to build and manage a website for your organization.

This short overview will take you through the basics you need to know in order to set up and manage the content on your site.
fields.title: Getting Started with Tendenci

fields.content:
The Dashboard is command central for your site. You can bring up the Dashboard at any time by clicking the Tendenci icon in the top left corner of your screen. (You must be logged in to see the icon.)

Icons

Each icon on the Dashboard represents a module that controls data or settings for your site.

For example, if you click Users, you will have the option to:

  • Search your User database,
  • Add new Users,
  • Edit User records and reset passwords, and
  • Control site reflexes associated with your Users, such as whether or not New Users are automatically signed up for your newsletter. 

Dashboard Nav Menu

Take a moment to run your mouse over the navigation bar at the top of your screen. As an alternative to using the Dashboard icons, you will find quick access to all of the things you will manage as site administrator. 

Tech Support

And don’t miss the links to “Search Helpfiles” and “E-mail Support” at the very bottom left.

The Tendenci help files are a great way to find answers to specific questions about using Tendenci. If you can’t find an answer there, contact our Support team!
fields.title: The Dashboard

fields.content:
Keeping your site content fresh is the best way to keep people coming back!

Content takes on many different forms:

  • Pages
  • Articles and News
  • Stories
  • Events
  • Photo Albums
  • And more!

Adding content in Tendenci is very simple. Just click the icon and go. (Or use the navigation link at the top of the screen for quick access.) Let's look at some examples.

Pages

Pages are simply that - web pages that live on your web site. Pages on your site will include things like "AboutUs" and "BenefitsofMembership".

To add a page, simply click the Pages icon and click Add - or choose Content > Pages > Add from the menu along the top. (Click here to add a page.)

Enter a page Title and Content. Note the friendly content editor that lets you format your text as if you were using a common word processing program! You can also insert images or other media files, such as video or sound clips, to add excitement to your page!

Note also the URL Path that is defaulted in based on the title. You will use this to reference this page later when you are editing your site navigation.

"Ineedaminutetofigureoutwhattowriteonmypage."

First draft not your best work? We get that. In Tendenci, you have the option to uncheck the Active box if you are not ready for the page to be visible to the public.

To reaccess and edit this page in the future, click the Pages icon in the Dashboard and click Edit.

Tada! You are building your site!!

Articles and News

Most of the latest and greatest from your group will show up in Articles and News. (or your Blog!)

Post your article or news story using a very similar interface as with Pages. Click here to add an article.

When a site visitor clicks on "ReadourLatestNews", they will see a list of your Articles or News stories. You may also display a few of the most recent Articles on the home page of your site.

Stories

Stories refer to articles outside of your organization that you want to highlight on your site.

For example, if you see an in-industry story on another web site that would be of interest to your people, you can add a reference and photo to your site that points back to the original source. It is a great way to share links with another organization and continually provide fresh and relevant content for your users!

Click here to add a story. Read on to learn about getting stories and articles to show up on the home page of your site!
fields.title: Adding Site Content

fields.content:
Now that you are comfortable with adding content, let's look at some ways to use that content creatively.

Displaying Content on the Home Page

The site template selected may display some of your content on the home page of your site. If you have an Events block on the home page – or maybe an Articles block – these items will automatically display as they are entered.

Other types of content will use Tags to determine what displays on the home page.

Using Tags

When adding content, you will often see a Tags field. Tags are used to pull various types of content to the Home Page of your website. In the following layout, the central image of the koala is a photo associated with a story titled Community Day at the Zoo. 

Note the four parts to the story: image, title, summary, and link to read more. (Click here to pull up the Add Story screen.) In order to get this story to appear in the Rotator section of the site template, the word rotator is put in the Tags field for this story when adding.

You can designate multiple stories with the "rotator" tag and your home page will rotate through all designated stories. Most sites have 3-5 stories targeted for rotation.

Other sections of your template will use different tags to display the story in different places with different formatting. Look for the tag label as you roll over each portion of the page.
fields.title: Homepage Content and Tags

fields.content:
Events are a great source of knowledge transfer, networking and income for your organization! Use your site to build excitement through promotion, sharing of details and early registration pricing! 

Adding Events

When adding Events in Tendenci, you will be able to:

  • Add complete event details
  • Include speaker info and images
  • Accept multiple payment types, including online payment (requires vendor account set up)
  • Set multiple pricing tiers

(Click here to add an event.)

Event Calendar Display

Use Event Types to color-code events for display on the site calendar. This is a quick way for your site visitors to separate meetings from deadlines, luncheons from galas!

Event List on the Home Page

Remember, your site template may display the next event automatically on your home page. Some templates will list the next three. Check out your home page to see how you are promoting your events!

Event Management

As the event approaches, you will use the flexibility of Tendenci to smoothly carry out all the last minute details. You can quickly:

  • Add phone-in registrations to the event
  • Cancel registrations if needed
  • Send reminders or program changes to registrants
  • Print a roster of attendees, including paid/unpaid status, to use at the check-in table!

What better way to promote this month's event than to show photos of your last awesome event?? Read on to learn how to add photos to your site!
fields.title: Calendar Events

fields.content:
What's the first thing people look for after a great event? Photos! Photo albums are a great way to keep the fire going after an event and encourage more registrants for the next one.

Adding photos to your site is super easy!!


Add the set

First, create the set. For example, May Luncheon or Annual Holiday Party. You can always uncheck the Active field while you build out the set.  

Content > Photo Sets > Add or Click here to create a photo set.

Add the photos

Then select the photos to be uploaded to that set and add titles, captions and tags!

After the photos have been uploaded, you can organize them in whatever order you wish and choose one for the "cover". You can also bulk edit the photo information, such as adding or changing tags for all photos.

Why put photos here instead of on another photo sharing web site?

Because YOU want the traffic! Instead of letting someone else host your photos, put your photos on your own site. Then you can link them to all your communications and promotions! Give access to the photo upload module to all your volunteer photographers and they can do the work! Then LINK LINK LINK!!

Now, how exactly are we going to link to all of this fabulous content? Read on to learn how to customize your site navigation!
fields.title: Photo Albums

fields.content:
Your site came with a standard navigation bar. As you customize your site, you may want to make changes to the Main Nav and add Sub Nav links. To do this, you will need (1) the URL of the page where you want the user to go and (2) a little bit of HTML know-how. Not much. If you are a newbie, you will catch on quick. Not to worry!

First, add your pages

We covered this back in the beginning. Remember the URL that was defaulted in for you? That is what we will need. Don't remember it? Go to Content>Pages>List. Then click on the page you want. Look at your URL. We need to grab everything immediately following your domain name.

To link to this page, you will need /about-us/.

Commit it to memory, write it down or better yet, open a new tab in your browser so you can quickly reference it.

Then, edit your navigation

You can find the link to update your navigation in the Admin Quick Links portion of the Dashboard. (Click here to open the Update Navigation window.)

Take a minute to look at this structure. It is just like an outline. The first level items are your Main Nav links. First, we reference the URL (these display in green), then we write the exact words we want to display in the navigation bar (these display in black). The Sub Nav links are in a second level list under one of your Main Nav links.

The easiest way to modify your nav is to copy/paste an existing line of code and then modify it. 

The navigation HTML above shows on your site like this:

Tendenci also stores previous versions of your nav right below the editing box. So if you really get yourself in a mess, just revert back to an earlier version, take a deep breath, and start over!

Remember that the Site Navigation is the primary tool your visitors will use to quickly find things on your site. Keep it simple and well-organized!
fields.title: Site Navigation

fields.content:
Well, that about covers it! At this point, you should be able to add and modify most of the content on your site.

Here are a few parting tips:

  1. Keep your content fresh! Add new articles, photos and stories regularly. Or start a blog on the site! Encourage multiple members of your organization to publish content on the site.
  2. Use photos! People love to see themselves on the site. This is a great way to show how much fun you had at your last event and encourage people to come to the next one!

  3. Make money off your Jobs Listings! Encouraging companies to list job openings in your database is not only a great service for your members, but can be a bigger money maker too! (We didn't cover this one but you will find the interface very similar.)

  4. Use the Help Files! Our users have built hundreds of help files on using Tendenci features, from very specific reflexes to addressing larger concepts. If you can't find it in the Tendenci Help Files, contact our Support Team!

Ready to get started?? Let's Go to the Dashboard!
